original_title: Sri Lanka’s CEB to make tariff cut proposal next week
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) will submit a proposal to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) to reduce electricity tariffs next week, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.
“The CEB will submit the electricity tariff reduction proposal to PUCSL next week,” Wijesekera said on X (twitter) on Wednesday (3).

Last month he said there would be a power tariff revision mid-January that will see electricity rates reduced to reflect the increased use of hydropower generation made possible by unusually high rainfall.
Wijesekera also said that the proposed reforms of the CEB will be presented to the Parliament with amendments for approval.

In anticipation of strike action by CEB employees against the bill, Wijesekera said “Instructions have been given to the CEB management to suspend and take appropriate disciplinary action against any employee that disrupts the services or acts in violation of the guidelines issued by the CEB management.” (Colombo/Jan3/2024)
